Dear Mr. Bennett:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/15/2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written
corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Four of the twelve new employee records reviewed did not contain 3 dated
references prior to employment as required by this rule. The first example had an
identified date of hire of 12/16/2019 and one of the three references was not dated.
The second example had an identified date of employment of 01/06/2020 and two of
her references were dated 01/23/2020. The third example had an identified date of
hire of 03/09/2020 with one reference dated 03/14/2020 and one reference dated
03/12/2020. The fourth example had an identified date of hire of 09/01/2020 and
two references dated prior to the date of hire but it did not include a third reference.
This is a repeat noncompliance from the renewal evaluation completed
11/14/2019.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person
whose function is covered by these rules has participated
in a minimum of 50 clock hours of planned training within
the first year of employment and a minimum of 25 clock
hours of training annually thereafter related to the
employee’s job function. At least 16 of the 50 hours
provided in the first year shall be orientation provided prior
to the assumption of duties.
1

Two of the three experienced staff records reviewed did not contain documentation
the staff members completed at least 25 clock hours of training for the annual year
2020. The first example had documented 17.5 hours of training and the second
example had documented 22 hours of annual training for 2020. This is a repeat
noncompliance from the renewal evaluation completed 11/14/2019.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(4) Training opportunities for direct care staff shall include, but
are not limited to, all of the following:
(h) First aid.
Four of the twelve new employee records reviewed did not contain documentation
the employee received 1st Aid training as a part of their training curriculum. These
employees had identified dates of hire of 12/16/2019, 02/10/2020, 06/01/2020, and
07/11/2020 respectively.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of
the
following information shall be documented in the case record
within 14 days after discharge:
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the services
provided while in residence, including medical and dental
services.
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that remain to be
met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations,
including medical and dental follow up that is needed, have
been reviewed with the resident and with the parent and with
the responsible case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
Two of the two discharged youth records reviewed contained discharge
documentation that did not include the identified areas of this rule that were required.
The appropriate forms/templates were used to document discharge information, but
the content of these documents did not include all of the identified information
required by this rule.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The facility submitted an acceptable corrective action plans for a special investigation
that identified a noncompliance with rule R 400.4157(1) and a special investigation
that identified a noncompliance with rule R 400.4142(1). The facility also submitted
an acceptable corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
11/14/2019. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that renewal evaluation
were R 400.4113(c)(e)(j), R 400.4128(3), R 400.4156(3)(e)(5), and R 400.4159(1).
Areas identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation are R
400.4113(e), and R 400.4128(3).
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on
their regular license.
